children.name: Text
children.value: I'm going to need every hour God sends.

children.name: Text
children.value: I won't give up, not now.

children.name: Text
children.value: A failure is never the end.

children.name: Text
children.value: For the love of La Corona!

children.name: Text
children.value: How am I to command amid such incompetence?!

children.name: Text
children.value: I think I have the measure of you.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'd sit you on a cannonball, and fire you out to sea.

children.name: Text
children.value: You need a dose of naval discipline!

children.name: Text
children.value: I will not be played for a fool!

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes I already know who you are. I? I am Admiral Vicente Silva.

children.name: Text
children.value: I, Silva, have the executive power of a nation, but for you, I won't need it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Speak; my clerk will put it all on record.

children.name: Text
children.value: Getting away from the action, are we?

children.name: Text
children.value: Please, sit. Have an almond, or a fig.

children.name: Text
children.value: What brings you out of your shell?

children.name: Text
children.value: Now then, what must you be after?

children.name: Text
children.value: So what if Empire's bad for everyone else - it's good for me.

children.name: Text
children.value: Governed as they think they want to be, that's the secret.

children.name: Text
children.value: People want to be shepharded, I don't need to wave my crook.

children.name: Text
children.value: My model town would be a barracks, divided into squares.

children.name: Text
children.value: Never rule as a general, but pretend you're a civilian.

children.name: Text
children.value: Navigation is more than part of our national history.

children.name: Text
children.value: La Corona was always an empire of seafarers, there's salt in our blood.

children.name: Text
children.value: I hope you know your flags and semaphore?

children.name: Text
children.value: I know every knot in every plank - no admiral should ever rise so high they forget.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can always rely on support.

children.name: Text
children.value: There may be a reward in time.

children.name: Text
children.value: Let's give ourselves a pat on the head.

children.name: Text
children.value: Not worth any more of my time!

children.name: Text
children.value: We must bivouac without brandy, and kayak without a paddle, on the road to victory.

children.name: Text
children.value: We must have imagination to lead, yet in war, nothing is left to the imagination.

children.name: Text
children.value: You better hope you've done your reading. Preparation is everything.

children.name: Text
children.value: Think your Queen has no disputed colonies, and freely grants independence when asked politely?

children.name: Text
children.value: La Corona, your Queen; empire is empire, a force of unstoppable destruction.

children.name: Text
children.value: I took this command because it has always been my destiny. Under my leadership, La Corona shall once more be victorious.

children.name: Text
children.value: Until La Corona is in open war with the Empire, your Queen is as much a friend as any.

children.name: Text
children.value: Princess Qing gave me a fine copy of the "Art of War". Of course I've read it a thousand times.

children.name: Text
children.value: Alonso's tactics are rash and confused, if he succeeds it will be down to luck!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hunt plays the old battleaxe, waiting to drop the decisive blow.

children.name: Text
children.value: La Fortune's days of piracy are numbered, La Corona will make sure of that!

children.name: Text
children.value: Artur needs to look up the definition of "man" in the dictionary.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel's rebels can't hide forever, the long arms of La Corona will soon tickle them out.

children.name: Text
children.value: Von Malching doesn't realise, it's not about money, it's about power.

children.name: Text
children.value: Why spree at Kahina's Emporium, when you can extract these goods at source?

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm not here to make friends.

children.name: Text
children.value: We have established an unbreakable chain of supply.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your steady trade is helping change the course of history!

children.name: Text
children.value: Your constant business is what empires thrive upon.

children.name: Text
children.value: I do have the advantage of experience.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ask for anything you wish, you won't get it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Let's do this by the book.

children.name: Text
children.value: Allow me to preside over our discussions.

children.name: Text
children.value: Take up your pen, and sign!

children.name: Text
children.value: You have no choice but to concede.

children.name: Text
children.value: I do not suffer fools gladly…

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm still dubious as to its merits.

children.name: Text
children.value: A lie we can agree upon.

children.name: Text
children.value: What sort of peasant do you think I am?

children.name: Text
children.value: I don't have to put up with this.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you're going to be stupid about it!

children.name: Text
children.value: Have you not seen my medals?

children.name: Text
children.value: You could at least try to sound menacing.

children.name: Text
children.value: No need to read the fine print.

children.name: Text
children.value: A show of altruism can be a tactic.

children.name: Text
children.value: Can't you see? I'm playing you.

children.name: Text
children.value: You are all that stands between victory and I.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm afraid war is my mission in life.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lucid minds do not bear grudges.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now, now, there has been anguish enough!

children.name: Text
children.value: This is your last chance of a truce.

children.name: Text
children.value: I too am a pragmatist, you see.

children.name: Text
children.value: Good tacticians take any advantage they can get.

children.name: Text
children.value: I need you to supply the front line.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm cutting your supply off at the pass.

children.name: Text
children.value: My armies have bread enough to march on.

children.name: Text
children.value: You could make a useful ally.

children.name: Text
children.value: What say we take the high ground?

children.name: Text
children.value: Doesn't really matter whose side you're on.

children.name: Text
children.value: Let's resolve things the way honourable people do.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm sure we can come to an arrangement.

children.name: Text
children.value: This, my good friend, is a bribe.

children.name: Text
children.value: I shall await your forfeiture in due course.

children.name: Text
children.value: Very well, but there's no use drawing this out.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fine, but it'll only be a matter of time.

children.name: Text
children.value: I hope you'll have something for dry skin?

children.name: Text
children.value: Who doesn't trade? You just embarrass yourself.

children.name: Text
children.value: Is this revenge? I don't understand.

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you a trader or are you not?

children.name: Text
children.value: I say learn from anyone, no matter their station.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you can't beat Empire, join it, eh?

children.name: Text
children.value: Do you know something I don't?

children.name: Text
children.value: And you would say that I'm arrogant.

children.name: Text
children.value: What can you give the man who has everything? More!

children.name: Text
children.value: Better to be short than short on brains!

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh, the vacuous vocab of the lower-middle classes.

children.name: Text
children.value: School was a long time ago, I am a master now.

children.name: Text
children.value: No-one looks as super-silly-ous as you do at present!

children.name: Text
children.value: Practice your pathetic attempts at flattery elsewhere.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't drool over me, you melon.

children.name: Text
children.value: My boots don't need any more spittle thank you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes well, I don't place much value in shows of emotion.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is no reason I should let your comments about my proud nation get to me.

children.name: Text
children.value: We are stronger day-on-day! This empire will never be forgotten, never!

children.name: Text
children.value: She never said the word boring! And it was I who chose to break it off!

children.name: Text
children.value: '89 was not a defeat! It was a tactical retreat!..and my first command!

children.name: Text
children.value: A greasy little epithet, but I'll give you marks for trying.

children.name: Text
children.value: Respect for your superiors, the sign of a reliable soldier.

children.name: Text
children.value: Flattery is it? Then call me flattered.

children.name: Text
children.value: "Despite my privilege I'm not so bad?" I'll take that as a compliment.

children.name: Text
children.value: You should know, I have misgivings about you.

children.name: Text
children.value: When I think about it, we aren't well-matched.

children.name: Text
children.value: A Luso always watches the horizon.

children.name: Text
children.value: Under scrutiny, I think you regress.

children.name: Text
children.value: Call me old-school, but I don't have to "like" anyone.

children.name: Text
children.value: My view on you hasn't changed.

children.name: Text
children.value: You could still be infantry material.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you could recognise them, you'd have good qualities.

children.name: Text
children.value: I've heard enough to think better of you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Opinion swings are common in statecraft.

children.name: Text
children.value: Current affairs show you in a favourable light.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm still trying to size you up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Strong allies are key to success.

children.name: Text
children.value: We all need people we can trust.

children.name: Text
children.value: I was wrong to think we shared a common foe.

children.name: Text
children.value: I think you are confused as to who your friends are.

children.name: Text
children.value: A pretty poor gambit to irk my allies.

children.name: Text
children.value: A weak move, that's my ally.

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes, an attack on two fronts!

children.name: Text
children.value: The least-honourable strategy toward my allies…

children.name: Text
children.value: I don't blame you for watching your back around them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our enemy's ranks will crumble from within.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail full of wind, no rudder in sight.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hearing about your achievements bores me to tears.

children.name: Text
children.value: You've stolen a march on our enemies.

children.name: Text
children.value: What are you building, an empire?!

children.name: Text
children.value: You'll soon know the difference between quality and quantity.

children.name: Text
children.value: And how are you going to manage all of those outposts?

children.name: Text
children.value: You don't seem to know what risk is.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thirst for conquest; one of my indulgences.

children.name: Text
children.value: Gains require blood, sweat and tears, happily not ours.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ambition is important, the best of us have it.

children.name: Text
children.value: A good leader uses every weapon at their disposal.

children.name: Text
children.value: As you see I've never struggled for money.

children.name: Text
children.value: As you see, the family wealth is considerable.

children.name: Text
children.value: Be honest, the responsibility is too much for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: I never agreed you could be a shareholder!

children.name: Text
children.value: Every man and his dog has money these days.

children.name: Text
children.value: This island is crucial, you'll ruin everything!

children.name: Text
children.value: You can't just go waltzing in!

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm glad you gave it up without a fight.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thanks for giving me a view of the battlefield.

children.name: Text
children.value: I only care for strategic outposts.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pillage marks the depraved, and the doomed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Those who go too far always regret it.

children.name: Text
children.value: The complete debellation of my legacy.

children.name: Text
children.value: You won't catch me off guard!

children.name: Text
children.value: Do you really need to fully sink them?

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes, well it's a Pyrrhic victory.

children.name: Text
children.value: Not cruel unless I need to be.

children.name: Text
children.value: You must have feared this would happen.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm not one for long speeches.

children.name: Text
children.value: Surely the decisive blow, no need to rub it in is there?

children.name: Text
children.value: That's it. Why bother now. You've got everything.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ha! HA! I got you. You my friend, have met your Water closet. I'm the king of the castle, you're the dirty rascal!

children.name: Text
children.value: That's it! I refuse to be part of this farce any more. You cheated. Cheated all the way along! It's the only possible hypothesis.

children.name: Text
children.value: The enemy is anyone who isn't your friend!

children.name: Text
children.value: My complex plans to conquer my ally, gone to waste!

children.name: Text
children.value: I can cross that off the list.

children.name: Text
children.value: I was going to take care of that myself.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your troops have fire in their bellies.

children.name: Text
children.value: All present and correct, I see.

children.name: Text
children.value: Haven't you heard the jangle of my medals?

children.name: Text
children.value: Paper, scissors, sink like a stone.

children.name: Text
children.value: Reading tactics? Didn't know you read.

children.name: Text
children.value: The moment we both have waited for. War is upon us!

children.name: Text
children.value: This should prove a memorable victory for our alliance.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have declared war on your ally, so you'd better choose carefully.

children.name: Text
children.value: Rolling in the big guns, sensible.

children.name: Text
children.value: Calling the cavalry; and not a moment too soon!

children.name: Text
children.value: "Viva Vicente, viva Vicente!" they'd go to the ends of the world for me.

children.name: Text
children.value: Expecting one of those gratuitous star fortresses? No such luck I'm afraid.

children.name: Text
children.value: Surely you don't think you can outflank me?

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm a man-o-war, and you're a jellyfish.

children.name: Text
children.value: No-one takes La Corona by sea.

children.name: Text
children.value: All it needs is a sharp deterrent!

children.name: Text
children.value: And don't stop there, be cruel if you have to.

children.name: Text
children.value: You come across as remarkably tenacious in your little rag.

children.name: Text
children.value: I like to read my fellow strategists.

children.name: Text
children.value: Keep the lower classes down, and all will be well.

children.name: Text
children.value: Keep the masses suppressed, and our troubles will soon pass.

children.name: Text
children.value: Empire could learn from the discipline of small businesses.

children.name: Text
children.value: Alonso can be defeated by watertight strategy.

children.name: Text
children.value: A worthy adversary, I wish you luck.

children.name: Text
children.value: Independence fighters— they are traitors to be executed!

children.name: Text
children.value: Allying with Graves takes things beyond unstable…

children.name: Text
children.value: Then Hunt has gotten herself a new puppet…

children.name: Text
children.value: Allying with the freedom pirate!? Incredible.

children.name: Text
children.value: History should never be forgotten— which wars were won, and who won them.

children.name: Text
children.value: There's always a small price for progress.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have amassed considerable forces, I must admit.

children.name: Text
children.value: Afraid to fight in the open?

children.name: Text
children.value: Only cowards skulk in the shadows.

children.name: Text
children.value: It's laughable you thought I wouldn't notice.

children.name: Text
children.value: One of my scouts losing their way, that's all.

children.name: Text
children.value: An inexcusable failure of my intelligence service.

children.name: Text
children.value: It's your fault I'm suspicious in the first place.

children.name: Text
children.value: Science can improve the economy and our quality of life.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your advances can't disguise your shoddy leadership.

children.name: Text
children.value: I wait for the right moment before I advance.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bente and I schooled together. She was rather more enthusiastic than I.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Princess brings a sense of magic to these shores.

children.name: Text
children.value: Willie Wibblesock's great ability is to break even the most joyful silence.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr Smith seems to have done everything - anything - one can think of.

children.name: Text
children.value: Disregard the cake-shop front - skeletons dangle in Beryl's pantry.

children.name: Text
children.value: Artur is rather a flamboyant peacock, perhaps we should leave him to strut.

children.name: Text
children.value: Carl is an odious man, I better prefer that you dealt with him.

children.name: Text
children.value: There are entire nations, sibling, who fear the name Alonso Graves.

children.name: Text
children.value: Vicente may seem cordial, but his is a rival empire.

children.name: Text
children.value: On your best behaviour, sibling; our Queen!

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald is the Queen's most trusted aide, father had not a bad word to say about him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Poor Anne's father was executed by the mad king, and now she is mad herself.

children.name: Text
children.value: Jean is a noble outlaw, but an outlaw nonetheless.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel desires freedom, and who would deny anybody that?

children.name: Text
children.value: Old Nate oftentimes looks to have just come down to breakfast.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr Bleakworth is a cowled hawk so unseeing and unhearing, you'd think he'd have learned to feel.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina has been a great comfort since father died, she knew him well.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady Margaret Hunt sent her sympathies the day father was arrested.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have never asked anything of you, firstborn. Not when you stole away a-tiptoe, leaving the family burden at your little sister’s door, nor in the hard years that since have followed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our father is accused of high treason. Dare you to believe it? Arrested, stripped of his knighthood. We...I am terribly shaken, and the vultures are already circling.

children.name: Text
children.value: Will you now stand by, knowing gentle father is endungeoned? It must kill him. Please come home. We need you.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have never asked anything of you, firstborn... Not when you stole away a-tiptoe, leaving the family burden at your little sister’s door ... Our father is accused of high treason, dare you believe it! ... Will you now stand by, knowing gentle father is endungeoned? ... It must kill him... Please come home, we need you...

children.name: Text
children.value: Is it really you, dearest sibling? I never dared hope you’d return. Do you remember Bright Sands? Of course you do; we loved it here. It’s changed now. The Royal Council support Uncle Edvard. Father barely cold, and he’s pulling everything down.

children.name: Text
children.value: Never told your friend of Goode and Sons? There is much to be said, but not now. Dear father’s funeral begins.

children.name: Text
children.value: No matter so few are here, when they are the few he loved most.

children.name: Text
children.value: We shall, dear sibling, for now. I have acquired a small island with the last of my funds, and passage for all still loyal to father. Together we shall clear his name or die trying.

children.name: Text
children.value: Please Miss Sarmento, we come here only to prove our father innocent— Samuel Goode.

children.name: Text
children.value: I don't know about you, but my father would never have betrayed his Queen!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are very sorry to hear your situation, still I must insist our father's...

children.name: Text
children.value: Maybe nothing need be sunk at all, majesty!

children.name: Text
children.value: Regard here, your Majesty! The Prosperity contract and our father's diary. The signatures do not match!

children.name: Text
children.value: And now compare with a freight document by our uncle Edvard. Do you see? He forged the signature in order to impersonate father!

children.name: Text
children.value: We hear you Isabel, but first we return to Bright Sands and confront uncle Edvard. His wicked masquerade is over!

children.name: Text
children.value: Gather your things Edvard. For your trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Samuel will forgive you on the other side, Edvard!

children.name: Text
children.value: See! Her Majesty is paying her last respects, just as Archie promised!

children.name: Text
children.value: From now on they rest side by side in the family vault.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bright Sands is returned to us, father's name is cleared. So, that will be all, eldest. Will you and Aarhant be leaving?

children.name: Text
children.value: I will not be fooled, Aarhant. I know that we shall one day be parted. But if my prayers be answered, today will not be that day— dearest sibling? Today is not a day for parting.

children.name: Text
children.value: What do you do here at the family crypt, Edvard? Do you vaunt your betrayal?

children.name: Text
children.value: Enough! It was you who sold Prosperity for the Pyrphorians! You forged father's signature! You sentenced him to death! But now the sentence is on you, uncle!

children.name: Text
children.value: And your guilt shall long outlive you, uncle. Look what you've done to our family.

children.name: Text
children.value: Father would never have! He was the Queen's stalwart, a member of the Royal Council, he...

children.name: Text
children.value: Help enough to demolish the larger ruins. Let's breathe some life into this place!

children.name: Text
children.value: Father wouldn't have wanted us to sit on our hands while our one prospect was in such a state.

children.name: Text
children.value: So let's gather our townsfolk and ask them to spruce the place up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mourning is eased now we have others for company, sibling.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your people are recovered, and desirous to proceed. Set them to it! We're going to need as much space as we can clear.

children.name: Text
children.value: Let Uncle Edvard scoff. A modest island yes, but if you’re at all like Father, you’ll look beyond appearances.

children.name: Text
children.value: We are running low on timber, but there's plenty in the ruins. We should clear some to stock up.

children.name: Text
children.value: We must shelter the good, loyal people who have shown solidarity with our family.

children.name: Text
children.value: We need every hand we can get if we are to expunge this debris.

children.name: Text
children.value: It's been a hard day of labour for us all, we should cater to our tired, hungry people!

children.name: Text
children.value: Timber, very good. I’ll try not to think of the coffin.

children.name: Text
children.value: He twists every article in his favour, at our and father’s expense!

children.name: Text
children.value: See what slander Edvard prints in Bright Sands!

children.name: Text
children.value: If only father were here, he'd have known what to do.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is not nearly as moribund here as it was.

children.name: Text
children.value: Those still loyal to Father will now turn to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: A moving tribute to see so many loyal to father trust in you.

children.name: Text
children.value: At such times it is good to occupy oneself with routine things.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm sure you know, but father was innocent.

children.name: Text
children.value: We must behave as if father were acquitted, as he one day will be.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is proving wise counsel. I'm glad you manged to make a friend while you were away.

children.name: Text
children.value: In times such as these, it is good to have people around us.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'll dream of Bright Sands until the day I can dream no more.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have father’s fortitude! These people will follow you as  they once followed him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Is there no limit to Uncle's shameless demands?

children.name: Text
children.value: I feel sick to the stomach that Edvard could ask so much of us so soon after father's death.

children.name: Text
children.value: That miserly, uncharitable…dastard! Picking and choosing what he inherits!

children.name: Text
children.value: Clearly Uncle's intention is to keep us  from ever owning a shipyard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Speak to our humble cousin! He writes of a worker riot in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: It seems we are not alone in our contempt for Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our dream of a shipyard is impossible without plenty of qualified hands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Workers can handle stubborn debris on Ditchwater. If it's to be the centre of our new enterprise it needs to be immaculate.

children.name: Text
children.value: Maybe Edvard will try to prevent us owning a shipyard, but for now let's at least house those workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Even I am astonished he could be this corrupt. We must put their cases before the highest authority, and hope for a retrial.

children.name: Text
children.value: It cannot be...these names are those father trusted most; barristers, doctors, academics.

children.name: Text
children.value: However much we despise Uncle Edvard, it's criminal to go opening his private correspondence!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am so relieved our legitimacy is no longer in question.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hurry, I already smell the tar, see the masts a-swaying from father’s study!

children.name: Text
children.value: We have to set personal feelings aside and do as Edvard asks.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard  becomes a monster inconceivably grotesque, but one we for now must keep fed.

children.name: Text
children.value: As this letter proves them innocent, let us hurry to Sir Archibald.

children.name: Text
children.value: For almost the first time since he passed, eldest, my heart is lifted.

children.name: Text
children.value: Building a shipyard is no small matter, our work is far from finsihed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Father would be ashamed to see his brother now.

children.name: Text
children.value: I shall not be a content with any ship, until I can say it is one we ourselves have built.

children.name: Text
children.value: The ship is another serendipity we should be grateful for.

children.name: Text
children.value: A commission for the Royal fleet! And in such quantity! A rare honour indeed!

children.name: Text
children.value: I find myself looking up to you, as the youngest often will.

children.name: Text
children.value: The weaponry they ask for presents a problem. I'm not even sure we have an iron lode, do we?

children.name: Text
children.value: I see the iron is beyond our reach. We have no choice but to find a way through the mountain.

children.name: Text
children.value: What are you both doing! Demolition is a serious matter wanting proper expertise!

children.name: Text
children.value: Father used Mr. Ticker on account of his good sense. Go, on, I suggest you find him in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah, he’s here. Try to make a good first impression, eldest; any friend of father is a friend of ours.

children.name: Text
children.value: Iron into Steel, Steel into Arms and we shall have fulfilled our first Royal commission!

children.name: Text
children.value: There is no shame in producing weapons if it is in defence of the realm, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: Granting such a prestigious commission shows the council may be willing to give us fair hearing.

children.name: Text
children.value: The last moneys I spent on Ditchwater appear well spent, eldest— and the faith I invested in you.

children.name: Text
children.value: This could be the start of something significant for us.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm sure if we have iron deposits, you can find them eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: If the royal fleet is to be at the cutting edge, we must start producing steel.

children.name: Text
children.value: Steel! How proud father would be.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have put in as much hard work as anyone else!

children.name: Text
children.value: To outfit our ships, we're going to need to fashion all that steel into weaponry.

children.name: Text
children.value: Perhaps we should sell ships to partners father trusted

children.name: Text
children.value: I predict inexhaustible demand for our steel!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are the beating heart of industry in the Empire.

children.name: Text
children.value: Exactly the sort of mischief I remember you by.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr.Ticker has years of experience in detonations, we must secure his services.

children.name: Text
children.value: Who would kill such a gentle man? Why?

children.name: Text
children.value: I knew all along Father could never have taken his own life. But that someone willfully took his...!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is father's diary! Quickly, what does he say!?

children.name: Text
children.value: Of course - the island over which he was accused of treason! That is what they are after.

children.name: Text
children.value: The diary may not be enough in itself to convince Sir Archibald, but it may give him food for thought.

children.name: Text
children.value: No doubt father thought this symbol germane. If anyone can interpret it, Madame Kahina can.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sarmento's last location is all we have. We need to plan our expedition route carefully.

children.name: Text
children.value: You look into this, eldest. I'm not sure I can face it.

children.name: Text
children.value: This is what we wanted after all. To know the truth.

children.name: Text
children.value: What could he have meant, eldest? I fear this mystery is only just begun.

children.name: Text
children.value: I now have more questions than answers, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: Father's killer was a nobody. Something greater conspires against our family.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh we are swept up in something now, eldest. And I am coming with you…

children.name: Text
children.value: I can think of no better than father's old friend Kahina, when it comes to pondering such mysteries.

children.name: Text
children.value: I wonder if Sir Archibald knows of this Pyrphorian threat? I think we have enough here to beg his  consideration again…

children.name: Text
children.value: Where is the contract that would be official proof of Prosperity's sale?

children.name: Text
children.value: It relates the sale of the island  Prosperity—the very reason father was branded a traitor.

children.name: Text
children.value: We cannot let the truth sink into the murk!

children.name: Text
children.value: Father’s own hand! Now we shall know his mind, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don’t be afraid to ask Madame Kahina, she became a good friend to father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Kahina is acquainted with the new world, she is sure to have seen this symbol before.

children.name: Text
children.value: All we have is Isabel’s last-known hideaway, and a world of unknowns in between.

children.name: Text
children.value: Prosperity is the cause of all this trouble. I already despise that wretched place.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can think of no better than father's old friend Kahina, when it comes to pondering mysteries.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you are going to do this, I am coming with you.

children.name: Text
children.value: At last the expedition has found Miss Sarmento. Let us hope she makes our journey worthwhile.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'll do anything to know the truth, even if it mean dealing with Isabel's rogues.

children.name: Text
children.value: As it stands, they are an easy target for the Pyrphorians. We should help, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have done more to protect her people than Isabel could possibly have hoped, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: From what we know of the Pyrphorians, I don't think it's enough yet to deter them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Prosperity— I want to see the island that caused all this with my own eyes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Then the Pyrphorians wanted Prosperity for the oil. No doubt to keep their fires burning.

children.name: Text
children.value: I think we can ask anything of Isabel with her people sheltered, defended and now supplied.

children.name: Text
children.value: This is about as much as she can ask for before she gives us a a bone to chew.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel is showing genuine gratitude. Perhaps she isn't the sort I thought.

children.name: Text
children.value: For the first time in my life, I know freedom.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel claims to know the whereabouts of the contract, and it is the only trail we have.

children.name: Text
children.value: I am so glad we are finally seeing the world together, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: There it is— Prosperity. The source of all our troubles.

children.name: Text
children.value: These fires cannot be due to the warm climate.

children.name: Text
children.value: The firemen confirm it was arson! These fires were set upon us!

children.name: Text
children.value: This monstrous fire-raising is deliberate. The Pyrphorians!

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel is mistaken. I won't hear these lies about father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Why has Isabel not yet given us the Prosperity contract? She is worryingly elusive on the subject.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel plays on our emotions. Still, if the sick could be carried to La Isla to convalesce…

children.name: Text
children.value: A messenger boy has brought us a letter.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is in Isabel's interest we find that contract! The Queen will realise she was forced into a deal.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm no more experienced in espionage than you, eldest. But this is our one chance to uncover the truth.

children.name: Text
children.value: We have to make this count, eldest. That contract will reveal all.

children.name: Text
children.value: You've gotten it! I never knew you had the ingenuity!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is father's signature, but in Edvard's hand! Edvard was behind this!

children.name: Text
children.value: I believe Sir Archibald when he says Her Majesty may do something drastic.

children.name: Text
children.value: Well done Eldest! You have served both Isabel and the Empire greatly.

children.name: Text
children.value: If this is the only way to get to the truth, then we must follow it.

children.name: Text
children.value: I know it's only paperwork, but the Pyrphorians cannot operate if Empire owns Prosperity again.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel was true to her word in the end. You have to admire her shrewdness.

children.name: Text
children.value: If Aarhant were here, I'm sure he'd have some good advice.

children.name: Text
children.value: To forge father's signature! Edvard must have been possessed!

children.name: Text
children.value: I would have been right to strike Edvard's cheek, the many times I had inclination!

children.name: Text
children.value: I will not rest until Edvard sees justice, even if I must escort him to the gallows myself!

children.name: Text
children.value: As Edvard is paraded to the town square, I want to be there in the front row.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard was the cause of all our grief! To see his face when he discovers we know!

children.name: Text
children.value: We confront Edvard this instant! I have so very many words for him!

children.name: Text
children.value: Cast-iron will make it very difficult for him to sidle away!

children.name: Text
children.value: I will indulge not one of the thousand apologies I presume he has ready.

children.name: Text
children.value: We should do what we can to get the evidence in order. No need to engage with Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen wants the trial to be an occasion. We better make sure we're ready.

children.name: Text
children.value: The evidence at such a high-profile inquiry must be absolutely watertight.

children.name: Text
children.value: Finally we can have our revenge on Edvard for all he has done.

children.name: Text
children.value: Leave no stone unturned. Who knows if Edvard has kept back other nasty surprises for us.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now we are ready for Her Majesty. All the eyes of the world will be upon us.

children.name: Text
children.value: If the Queen wants to make a big song and dance of the trial, we better see to it.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen's visit, not the trial, may be the greatest occasion of your people's lives.

children.name: Text
children.value: I don't know what I would do without you, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: Everything comes under scrutiny in the presence of royalty.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is as good as dead to me.

children.name: Text
children.value: I will not look at him at the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Concentrate on securing a verdict for Edvard!

children.name: Text
children.value: You were out there in paradise, and I dragged you into all this. I'm sorry.

children.name: Text
children.value: You are the one positive in all of this. No sister could have asked for more.

children.name: Text
children.value: Is this business really nearly over, eldest? I don't feel any better for all we've dug up.

children.name: Text
children.value: I should have seen through it. Saved father while I had the chance.

children.name: Text
children.value: You cannot allow Bright Sands to be subjugated! Our childhood home!

children.name: Text
children.value: Bright Sands! You must save them!

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard… He suffered enough eldest. I believe I can forgive him now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now we are all that remains, eldest. I intend to take strength from that.

children.name: Text
children.value: We will not give in to terror! Never!

children.name: Text
children.value: We must avenge Edvard— father,  the only way we can.

children.name: Text
children.value: Come what may, I am not afraid.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is only one way left, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: What you did goes far beyond us, dear blood. You have saved us all from a reign of terror.

children.name: Text
children.value: It shall be a proper funeral. Let us reunite the two brothers, side-by-side. Once and for all, confine the past to the past.

children.name: Text
children.value: We must bury them both together in the family tomb.

children.name: Text
children.value: Let us talk once Samuel and Edvard have taken their rightful place side-by-side.

children.name: Text
children.value: I do not feel any more sadness, eldest. The clouds have lifted— azure skies lie beyond.

children.name: Text
children.value: Have joy in your heart, as you make these final arrangements.

children.name: Text
children.value: They will not have Bright Sands!

children.name: Text
children.value: Another glimmer! Isabel fights beside us.

children.name: Text
children.value: They will not stop you, eldest. Lead us forth!

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire rages everywhere! We must unmask these arsonists before its too late!

children.name: Text
children.value: There will be nothing left of the city if the arsonists remain on the prowl!

children.name: Text
children.value: Now the fires are out of control, and the arsonists still loose!

children.name: Text
children.value: Quickly, the civilians! I won't see them swept up in the fighting!

children.name: Text
children.value: Bright Sands is no place for civilians! We must come to their rescue!

children.name: Text
children.value: Find a way to extract them unnoticed!

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard was ready to make peace with himself at the end.

children.name: Text
children.value: Father always wanted you to have Bright Sands. The past cannot hold you any more.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard died far better than he lived. He is forgiven.

children.name: Text
children.value: If father had but held Edvard— shown his affection.

children.name: Text
children.value: When I come here, I bring only cattails— for peace and prosperity.

children.name: Text
children.value: These stones are not cold, but warm. The sun is shining again.

children.name: Text
children.value: The past is buried but not forgotten.

children.name: Text
children.value: Here's a thing, eldest. Please be punctual.

children.name: Text
children.value: Most people would jump at this chance.

children.name: Text
children.value: It would be a compelling task for anyone.

children.name: Text
children.value: I wonder if you can find it within yourself—helping your little sister?

children.name: Text
children.value: Of course this business is far too lively for me...

children.name: Text
children.value: I shall attend other errands meanwhile.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't feel you have to do this as a courtesy to me.

children.name: Text
children.value: I shall await you by cheerily sifting through paper.

children.name: Text
children.value: I always appreciate your help, however overdue.

children.name: Text
children.value: Rare for promises to be kept, thank you.

children.name: Text
children.value: You restore a grain of my trust in humanity, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm not going to say I didn't think it possible.

children.name: Text
children.value: Given up? That is the luxury of inconstancy.

children.name: Text
children.value: As you wish, after all I managed without you before.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm sure you did your utmost.

children.name: Text
children.value: I doubt there is anything more you could have done.

children.name: Text
children.value: It's alright, I didn't expect it would go very well.

children.name: Text
children.value: I dream of some kind of news.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can ask, but after that it is up to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Am I to understand my petition goes unheard?

children.name: Text
children.value: Every duty you fulfil will help build others' trust in you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Why, not one, but several prospects in quick succession!

children.name: Text
children.value: Another appointment, when will the excitement end!?

children.name: Text
children.value: Eldest, if you have any heart at all...I am your kith and kin.

children.name: Text
children.value: Could you really have it on your conscience?

children.name: Text
children.value: Dare I believe it is good news you bring?

children.name: Text
children.value: Speak to me, I am ready for the worst.

children.name: Text
children.value: Nothing but paperwork to be done...

children.name: Text
children.value: I am more hopeful than I was.

children.name: Text
children.value: I shouldn't complain at times like these.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm happy for you, really I am.

children.name: Text
children.value: You might feel rather pleased with yourself.

children.name: Text
children.value: You've kept things in good order.

children.name: Text
children.value: You work with reassuring method, eldest.

children.name: Text
children.value: This grim monotony is worse than life.

children.name: Text
children.value: I should like to be someone else.

children.name: Text
children.value: I find this all so trivial.

children.name: Text
children.value: I want to feel something, just not irritable!

children.name: Text
children.value: You give me no comfort at present.

children.name: Text
children.value: I worried you might be this sort of person.

children.name: Text
children.value: A quaint interpretation of precision, sibling.

children.name: Text
children.value: When you overlook minutiaie, things go awry.

children.name: Text
children.value: And it's all the harder when one is alone!

children.name: Text
children.value: It's a disordered tangle of briar, sibling.

children.name: Text
children.value: Then you are the long lost sibling. Hallo. I hope we can come to know one another a little.

children.name: Text
children.value: I never thought I'd see you again, sibling. I hope your return coincides with better times.

children.name: Text
children.value: I've been holding fort, as ever.

children.name: Text
children.value: You seem to come and go as you please.

children.name: Text
children.value: I did wonder if you'd come by.

children.name: Text
children.value: Well, I shan't be an ingrate.

children.name: Text
children.value: A thank you is probably in order.

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh what does it matter either way...

children.name: Text
children.value: What else can I do but accept...

children.name: Text
children.value: If only I had the invitingly empty sort of paper for writing, not lined, for accounting.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fictions only remind me how little of my own writing I've done lately.

children.name: Text
children.value: If ever I seem far away, remember so were you, those long years.

children.name: Text
children.value: One should get to know one's kin, shouldn't one?

children.name: Text
children.value: Getting things done bright and early maintains discipline for the remaining day.

children.name: Text
children.value: After a jam scone at teatime, I feel a different person. That is to say, a sympathetic one.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can't see how any woman finds calisthenics remotely emancipating.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have to make do with living vicariously through your exploits.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have discovered some inefficiencies we ought to address...

children.name: Text
children.value: Our business is being adversely affected by urgent matters we ought to resolve...

children.name: Text
children.value: Here is a matter of the utmost importance we must knock on the head!

children.name: Text
children.value: There is a defect in the economic machine that you ought to correct...

children.name: Text
children.value: A concern has raised its ugly head, that I don't think can wait...

children.name: Text
children.value: Oh this is terrible! We have to save the situation in any way we can!

children.name: Text
children.value: Every settlement needs a market. The people want a place for supplies, provide it!

children.name: Text
children.value: I checked the manifests. Not all our facilities are able to deliver the goods they produce. Please correct the situation!

children.name: Text
children.value: Our settlement is rather small. You will have to attract more farmers if you want to make progress.

children.name: Text
children.value: The farmers are hungry. You'll have to supply them with the necessary, starting with fish.

children.name: Text
children.value: Everything you've built so far consumed wood. We'll be needing more of it to continue.

children.name: Text
children.value: I've been going over the accounts. There is no denying it, we're close to bankruptcy! Avert this disaster!

children.name: Text
children.value: The land can only be farmed if there are enough fields. We must plant them!

children.name: Text
children.value: Work is going unfinished. We must ensure we have sufficient workforce to finish it!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are missing a vital good that cannot be produced on our island. You will have to find a way to import it!

children.name: Text
children.value: You have prepared everything. Now is the time to advance by settling the first workers!

children.name: Text
children.value: Without electricity some facilities won't run. You have to set up the preliminaries to get them going!

children.name: Text
children.value: Our docks are primed for a first ship launch! Everyone waits on your signal!

children.name: Text
children.value: Our city is noteworthy enough to attract its first visitors. We must be sure to make all the necessary arrangements!

children.name: Text
children.value: Numbers, accounts, indices. What might otherwise be a worry to you are my affairs. I'll stay close by in case you should need support.

children.name: Text
children.value: Since that day you saved my life, I have presumed I knew you. But now...

children.name: Text
children.value: A thousand letters from your father go unopened, yet one scribble from your sister changes everything? I didn't even know you had a sister!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are broke, old pal! We can’t afford a passage back to the old world, back to your family! Not unless you’ve suddenly remembered what work is.

children.name: Text
children.value: So this is it. We're leaving paradise behind. You never talked much about family and the like, but you’re dead serious about this, aren’t you? No matter, I made a vow to defend you. And I don't break an oath, even if a blind man could see you leap into the deepest pit of dung.

children.name: Text
children.value: All those houses! You never said how wealthy you were. Why were we selling fish and sleeping in barns?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Looks like death claimed the wrong brother.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your sister reminds me of you. Must mean new adventures await, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now that sounds like good news.

children.name: Text
children.value: Who are all these busybodies? Blowing up rocks can't be that complicated!

children.name: Text
children.value: Ha! My apologies, that was indeed impressive! Is there anything dynamite won't solve, I wonder?

children.name: Text
children.value: Look! Devils from below breathing fire and flame!

children.name: Text
children.value: We are not afraid of cowards hiding behind masks.

children.name: Text
children.value: Their fleet is formidable. I count many ships.

children.name: Text
children.value: Yes, just look at her. I bet she already forgot who we are.

children.name: Text
children.value: Liar! You are the picture of regret!

children.name: Text
children.value: You don't understand pain. Real pain.

children.name: Text
children.value: We're nearing the place your father died. Whatever happens, stay calm!

children.name: Text
children.value: We didn't come here to be insulted, we came to strike a bargain. The demolitions man Thomas, we want him.

children.name: Text
children.value: It's been a long hard day. The people need to rest. And maybe wet their whistles.

children.name: Text
children.value: A cloud still hangs over this place, please make it go away!

children.name: Text
children.value: She has you doing all those chores you tried to leave behind.

children.name: Text
children.value: Everything pivots on this enterprise for your sister, I won't watch you let her down.

children.name: Text
children.value: You're better with humankind than I used to believe.

children.name: Text
children.value: First the weather, now the people!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is not rain but wet mist! And endless! What are we doing here?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Disrespectful chatter abounds about your father, and how he died.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sometimes feels like your sister hardly knows you.

children.name: Text
children.value: The tin rush left this island ugly.

children.name: Text
children.value: Funny to watch you get your hands dirty.

children.name: Text
children.value: So serious all of a sudden. Where’s that old spirit of yours gone?

children.name: Text
children.value: He certainly knows how to silence his critics.

children.name: Text
children.value: A letter, it bears Edvard’s Seal!

children.name: Text
children.value: Open the letter, he's clearly up to no good!

children.name: Text
children.value: Though the burden is lifted, Edvard will keep you headlocked for life if you allow him to.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard has shown his weakness as a leader, we must exploit it.

children.name: Text
children.value: This is our chance to show Edvard who rules the waves.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sometimes doing the wrong thing, is the right thing, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Why would we need a licence to build a boat? Seems that's how it is here...

children.name: Text
children.value: Once this shipyard is built, we can gesture rudely at Edvard, and go back to adventuring.

children.name: Text
children.value: She says it's "your" shipyard? Does this mean we're going to be here forever?

children.name: Text
children.value: All I smell on your Uncle is greed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don’t grovel for your Uncle. He has no power over you.

children.name: Text
children.value: You do know Edvard has no intention of lifting that debt?

children.name: Text
children.value: Still have a few sticks of dynamite! We can blow our way through!

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Ticker has opened my eyes to the world of controlled destruction!

children.name: Text
children.value: Perhaps not refined enough for your sister, but at least your workers can start their dig.

children.name: Text
children.value: Always dangerous, getting wrapped-up in the business of a Queen.

children.name: Text
children.value: My bond is to you, not to your monarch.

children.name: Text
children.value: You're part of it now, just like your father was.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once you reach the top there's only one way from there.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm still waiting for the boom!

children.name: Text
children.value: I suppose it is better to let the experts handle it.

children.name: Text
children.value: My sword is fashioned from Ukku steel, but to produce in these quantities!

children.name: Text
children.value: This steel will command great value.

children.name: Text
children.value: I never imagined a city could grow so fast.

children.name: Text
children.value: You're a real fat cat now! Hope you remember one day how you got here…

children.name: Text
children.value: The workers may as well start preparing for the detonation.

children.name: Text
children.value: Admit it, you’d never have hired a demolition expert in the old days.

children.name: Text
children.value: The way to the iron mines is clear!

children.name: Text
children.value: Perhaps you can help me understand who keeps a murder under their hat? Forgive me, I know we speak of your father…

children.name: Text
children.value: The foul scent of a killer. We cannot let him escape.

children.name: Text
children.value: Someone supplies the murderer from Madame Kahina's harbour? We should investigate.

children.name: Text
children.value: The locals say that trading ship over there belongs to a stranger. Maybe that's the supplier!

children.name: Text
children.value: He freely admits to his crime! Get him!

children.name: Text
children.value: No, he is dead! It cannot end here, we have no answers!

children.name: Text
children.value: There must be some clue among the wreckage, anything!

children.name: Text
children.value: An assortment to make the blood curdle!

children.name: Text
children.value: A tiger must stay low and close to his prey.

children.name: Text
children.value: Still your rage. The trail may not end here.

children.name: Text
children.value: There, that must be the villain's ship!

children.name: Text
children.value: Keep a good distance, but don't let the wretch slip away.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your father's testament is clear! No guilty man would write with such confidence!

children.name: Text
children.value: There is the ship. Let's keep our distance, see where it goes.

children.name: Text
children.value: His words are a warning. Whoever our nemesis is, they are many steps ahead.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can't believe you left me to look ater shop.

children.name: Text
children.value: This is not what I was born to do.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our bond is being seriously tested. What are all these papers?

children.name: Text
children.value: Admit it, you've forgotten about me.

children.name: Text
children.value: How did Hannah do this all those years? I'm beginning to feel her pain.

children.name: Text
children.value: I've got people asking me which palette of what needs to go where!

children.name: Text
children.value: If you'd taken me with you, I could have helped!

children.name: Text
children.value: I hear you ducked out of a war. Not for the first time, eh, old pal?

children.name: Text
children.value: Now is no time for boldness, but caution.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't distract me, old pal. I'm getting better at accounting!

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard! I told you he was rotten as a fig.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is behind this? He's pathetic.

children.name: Text
children.value: There's a space between revenge and forgiveness.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your ill tidings come as no surprise to me. Edvard's face betrays the game is up.

children.name: Text
children.value: There will be punishment. But Edvard has suffered from the day Samuel died.

children.name: Text
children.value: Whatever the punishment, the damage to Edvard is already done.

children.name: Text
children.value: We must prepare for a reckoning. Edvard was never the true enemy.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is the Pyrphorians behind all of this, we cannot neglect the threat they pose.

children.name: Text
children.value: The trial is a distraction. The real danger we are yet to face.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is a start. But the Pyphorians are many.

children.name: Text
children.value: Do everything to make sure the Queen is safe, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: It will be an honour to have the Queen here, but not without risk.

children.name: Text
children.value: Good but the Queen may still be vulnerable.

children.name: Text
children.value: Stay attuned. This is the perfect time for our enemy to recover.

children.name: Text
children.value: We have seen nothing of the Pyrphorian order but their minions so far.

children.name: Text
children.value: Whoever is behind the Pyrphorians will take this time to weigh their options.

children.name: Text
children.value: We cannot let this business with Edvard divert us from the real threat.

children.name: Text
children.value: Black clouds loom my old friend, be ready to raise your umbrella.

children.name: Text
children.value: I feel uneasy, and it's not the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Even if we cannot forgive Edvard, we have to learn to let it go.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have met the jury. They are idiots!

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen certainly speaks her mind.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians have seized Bright Sands. They enchain it to their foul cause!

children.name: Text
children.value: The skies above Bright Sands glow with maleficence!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is time, old pal. Our nemesis approaches!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is time we stamped this fire for good.

children.name: Text
children.value: When they see how bright you burn old pal, they will shrivel.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have my blade. I am ready.

children.name: Text
children.value: Old friend, it's over! The last Pyrphorians are sunk!

children.name: Text
children.value: Before all this began, I owed you a debt. I may have paid it now, but I've made up my mind to stay old pal, help you grow, at least a little longer.

children.name: Text
children.value: Dynamite fishing?! You're serious? Well, the village north is always short on food.

children.name: Text
children.value: Remember when we escaped the pits back when? Still some dynamite left.

children.name: Text
children.value: I hid it next to the abandoned lighthouse. Come and fetch it!

children.name: Text
children.value: Here it is! Just get plenty of distance on the throw.

children.name: Text
children.value: The dynamite is at the lighthouse, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: They're not expecting Queen Parrotfish; anything with fins will do.

children.name: Text
children.value: All the blistered fish they could ever want.

children.name: Text
children.value: A long sea journey won't make me give up my vow to stick by you.

children.name: Text
children.value: I owe my life to you. You go, I follow, until I decide that debt is paid.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you've never told me you had a  sister, what else haven't you told me about?

children.name: Text
children.value: Sometimes you have to face the past to have a future.

children.name: Text
children.value: A bird with a spear would be faster.

children.name: Text
children.value: You’re just destroying coral, you clown.

children.name: Text
children.value: You couldn’t hit an cow’s arse with a sitar.

children.name: Text
children.value: Still trying to get used to that smell of char.

children.name: Text
children.value: You do have an eye for opportunity. After all, it’s not TNT the locals are short of.

children.name: Text
children.value: Are we leaving on a packet ship, or has the wind blown through your ears again?

children.name: Text
children.value: If it's you lighting the fuse, I'm going to keep well back.

children.name: Text
children.value: Must be plenty of fish in this bay.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't look at me— dynamite was your idea.

children.name: Text
children.value: I decide when my vigil ends.

children.name: Text
children.value: This better be a call to adventure.

children.name: Text
children.value: Good to see you, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Purge the filth of ego inside yourself!

children.name: Text
children.value: Want to be a hero? Try being a human first.

children.name: Text
children.value: Get a grip on your destiny.

children.name: Text
children.value: I know you. This isn't you.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you seek heaven, you have far to go.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you go down, I'll go down with you.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'd rather be stuck at sea.

children.name: Text
children.value: For once you have my respect, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: You bust the world open like ripe fruit.

children.name: Text
children.value: Good fire-breather! Thaw this frozen wasteland.

children.name: Text
children.value: Conquer your mind, conquer the world.

children.name: Text
children.value: No sun, but somehow all rosy.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ah old pal, it's been a while since we adventured together.

children.name: Text
children.value: I've been waiting for your call old pal, wherever you go I will follow.

children.name: Text
children.value: The land of many rivers shall see me again, when all is forgiven.

children.name: Text
children.value: Old pal, you don't find it strange they keep the recipe for sausage so secret?!

children.name: Text
children.value: If the body is the field in which the mind works, would you farm on barren soil?

children.name: Text
children.value: Do not incite violence. Prepare for it.

children.name: Text
children.value: The music here is fine, but it lacks the colour of a raga.

children.name: Text
children.value: I vowed to defend you, it requires no explanation.

children.name: Text
children.value: Compared to what brought us together, this is nothing old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: We met in war; we will find ourselves there again. We must be prepared for that moment.

children.name: Text
children.value: I never renounced my faith I'm just taking a pause.

children.name: Text
children.value: A pot of gold for the milk of a lioness.

children.name: Text
children.value: Our bond runs two ways, does it not?

children.name: Text
children.value: Here's a chance to let off some steam.

children.name: Text
children.value: In the old days we'd have done this in our sleep.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once again, I am indebted to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: See how the whole world bows before us!

children.name: Text
children.value: Might sparring bring your focus back?

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't blame yourself, it was not to be.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lady luck wasn't on our side.

children.name: Text
children.value: If I cannot trust you, who can?

children.name: Text
children.value: Changed your mind? They do say change is all we have.

children.name: Text
children.value: Do I see a happy face?

children.name: Text
children.value: Care to tell me how it went?

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't expect to succeed sitting on your heels.

children.name: Text
children.value: Back home, it's shameful to have to ask twice.

children.name: Text
children.value: I don't know if you should let down your guard just yet.

children.name: Text
children.value: Seems God chose you to do good deeds.

children.name: Text
children.value: You know once you stop, I can't be your friend any more.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't let them lead you astray.

children.name: Text
children.value: Leave it with me for a while.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm still making inquiries, old pal.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'll be onto something soon, I know it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you ready to follow the ship?

children.name: Text
children.value: I've been pondering this problem for a long time, and I feel now is the time to act!

children.name: Text
children.value: This cloud has been looming for some time, we must disperse it!

children.name: Text
children.value: This might not seem a problem now, but it could one day spiral out of control!

children.name: Text
children.value: It is easy to dismiss these things as trivial, but history shows us othewise...

children.name: Text
children.value: You must dispel this illusion, before it becomes real...

children.name: Text
children.value: A terror! How did we not foresee it?! We must act swiftly!

children.name: Text
children.value: I am the good observer, my friend. When there is more than meets the eye, I will let you know.

children.name: Text
children.value: The first step is your most important. Make sure to moor at a shore that provides all the soils we need!

children.name: Text
children.value: People here are too lazy to go across country. Lay a street!

children.name: Text
children.value: People need somewhere to drown their sorrows. A pub will fill this town with laughter!

children.name: Text
children.value: Fear not the new world that awaits. You only have to set sail into the unknown!

children.name: Text
children.value: Bad news! A greedy rival seized the majority of shares on one of your islands. Take back control!

children.name: Text
children.value: War! This is serious! End the violence however you can!

children.name: Text
children.value: We've been climbers, but our power of influence has now worn out. We have to recover some of our leverage.

children.name: Text
children.value: Study your texts! Going through your notes once in a while might be quite helpful.

children.name: Text
children.value: So you started making plans, measuring the land. Good. Come back to it once you have everything set!

children.name: Text
children.value: When I look into your people's faces I see trouble. Make sure their misery doesn't become a problem!

children.name: Text
children.value: Your people oppose you! Find a way to solve this dangerous predicament soon!

children.name: Text
children.value: Flames surge everywhere! Fight this inferno fast!

children.name: Text
children.value: Where have you been? Without you brats we’ll never be done with this obligation!

children.name: Text
children.value: Nobody likes a traitor, let alone his tainted offspring. Better make yourself scarce.

children.name: Text
children.value: What? Has your cleft of the family no shame, that it now resorts to abducting my workers? The Queen’s ambassador himself shall hear of this.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pencil-polishing popinjay! I should have been rid of you long ago!

children.name: Text
children.value: The real tragedy here is the vast funeral bill that goes unpaid, while this brat is living the life of O'Reilly!

children.name: Text
children.value: No, child. It's too late. Judgement has already come.

children.name: Text
children.value: No please, don't be afraid. It's time to let go. My ship has sailed...

children.name: Text
children.value: What are you talking about, child? Only a talk between brothers, that's all.

children.name: Text
children.value: From the moment I saw you, I knew it meant trouble.

children.name: Text
children.value: I knew this would happen. I was just saying to your father, I'll never come up to him— not even having sacrificed it all.

children.name: Text
children.value: He never understood the pain, of my life in his shadow.

children.name: Text
children.value: I can't be scared. No more than I am already.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians are pure evil. I thought I had control of this frightful arrangement, but when they murdered Samuel, I realised a day would come that they came for me too. The day they purge this decaying Empire with fire and flame.

children.name: Text
children.value: Lo and behold, Her Majesty! Finally, I became worthy of her notice.

children.name: Text
children.value: Were you expecting celebrations and a fatted calf on your return?

children.name: Text
children.value: I think it was probably your absence in the end that did for your father.

children.name: Text
children.value: What, still here? Establishing a rival company? On that dishevelled island?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Do you remain here out of spite, or is this some futile attempt at competition?

children.name: Text
children.value: You'll not have a dribble of inheritance after all your frivolity out in god-knows-where.

children.name: Text
children.value: Prosperity's sale is a disaster for the Empire, the Queen has said as much to me herself!

children.name: Text
children.value: Prosperity, sold to South American rebels, can you imagine?!

children.name: Text
children.value: Had you expected a fatted calf to be slit upon your return?

children.name: Text
children.value: You must now see, no-one wants you here.

children.name: Text
children.value: As you are so desperate to appear responsible, you’ll be pleased to hear the cost of that fantastical funeral falls to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your worthless rags have barely covered anything. Now bring me sails— It's not like you have any use for them!

children.name: Text
children.value: Repay me now, or sell up!

children.name: Text
children.value: Baa baa black sheep, have you any wool? Yes sir, yes sir, four bags full.

children.name: Text
children.value: Good kid. Go on now, I'll let you know when I think of the next thing.

children.name: Text
children.value: Feels an eternity since the funeral— and the cost! Why it was extortionate!

children.name: Text
children.value: I loathe the reek of lanolin, but if farmers smocks are all you have...

children.name: Text
children.value: Haven't seen a prison transport of mine, have you? If you do, be sure to return any salvage to me.

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't even think about sheltering Samuel’s co-conspirators! Deliver them to prison at once, and I might lift your debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have seen sense then. I suppose I shall have to inform Sir Archibald that your obligations are met.

children.name: Text
children.value: That was none of your business! And what right has the crown to meddle in my accounts? What right?!

children.name: Text
children.value: How long can it take to peel a potato?

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you darning the things yourself?

children.name: Text
children.value: The longer you wait, the less inclined I shall be to writing off your sizeable debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: A few bottles of bathtub booze?

children.name: Text
children.value: Has your cleft of the family no shame, that it now resorts to theft?

children.name: Text
children.value: What are you up to overseas?

children.name: Text
children.value: When will you give up pursuing the past and look to your future as my charge?

children.name: Text
children.value: Gallivanting off again? People will call you irresponsible!

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald sent you, did he?

children.name: Text
children.value: You worked so hard to defy me! Then you run away again!

children.name: Text
children.value: Have you met with any difficulty out there?

children.name: Text
children.value: I promise not to ask any more of you, if you were to spend more time here.

children.name: Text
children.value: You don't know what you do.

children.name: Text
children.value: That island was signed off in Samuel's name!

children.name: Text
children.value: Forget me, my race is run. There is a true devil is loose. It must be vanquished.

children.name: Text
children.value: My defeat can still be your victory.

children.name: Text
children.value: I know you want a villain, but this plot goes far beyond my petty greed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Then you have all I can give you. I pray that will be enough.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'm sure you wish it was I had died. Well soon you may have your wish.

children.name: Text
children.value: Prosperity - it was only the beginning. These people will destroy eveything, everyone if they have to.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is a great danger to the established order. I will give you any help I can.

children.name: Text
children.value: My life may be forfeit, but I can still do a last bit of good.

children.name: Text
children.value: I didn't know what I was getting into, and then it was too late.

children.name: Text
children.value: My father never loved me, only  Samuel those long years.

children.name: Text
children.value: I sold our family down the river, no use hiding that now.

children.name: Text
children.value: I regret everything. I know what Hannah must think of me.

children.name: Text
children.value: I will not play the martyr, but I am ready to sacrifice myself for you and your sister's happiness.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have been selfish, but I am not one of them, I never was. You must believe me.

children.name: Text
children.value: I did not know they would kill Samuel for it, I had no idea!

children.name: Text
children.value: Lift a finger for your last significant family!

children.name: Text
children.value: Are you just going to stand by?

children.name: Text
children.value: I'll bet you're too spoiled to do as you're told.

children.name: Text
children.value: I'll believe it when I see it.

children.name: Text
children.value: It shouldn't be about the material reward, but here.

children.name: Text
children.value: Be thankful to the one who gave you such an opportunity.

children.name: Text
children.value: Never say I don't help you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Finally discovered a sense of duty, have we?

children.name: Text
children.value: I suppose you'll want paying now?

children.name: Text
children.value: Betrayal must run in the family!
